result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dana Marie Littles

defendant.name: Littles, Dana Marie
defendant.address: 615 E Washington Ave, c/o The Beacon, Madison, WI 53703

records.addlTxt: Defendant accepted into FOP; contract terminates September 19, 2023

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Marvin W.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Dana Marie Littles in court.  Attorney Nancy L. Moore in court for Dana Marie Littles.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties agree to remove pretrial services as a condition of bond. All other bail conditions will remain the same. 

DE given information to stop at the clerk of courts office to sign new bond forms.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Dana Marie Littles in court.  Attorney Nancy L. Moore in court for Dana Marie Littles.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 3. Counts 1 and 2 are dismissed. Court accepted def's plea but w/h adjudication and referred def to FOP. Bail continued.
Parties reach an agreement and request Plea dates.
Plea hearing on August 23, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Atty Moore requested a set over of the status conferences for 30 days. The court approved this request.
Status conference on July 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Nancy Moore is appointed for the DE

ADDRESS INFO for Dana Marie Littles
Current: 615 E Washington Ave, c/o The Beacon, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 05-18-2022)
Prior: 34 Powers Ave 3, Madison, WI 53714
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Marvin W. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

03:35 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
